page.title: 12Rowhedge Then By Daisy B
page.content:
By Daisy Bellman
{Elizabeth Watling}&{Michael Tobin}went to see{Mrs Daisy Huggins}who had started at{St Lawrencc School}in{1907. They asked her about her childhood when she was Daisy Bellman.
"There were a lot a more shops in Roehedge. people did not have to go into Colchester for such things as fish, meat or to buy or repair shoes. The roads were dusty in summer and muddy in winter as there was no tar, when tar did come it brought more traffic to Rowhedge. Dr Sanderson said to me "I would have liked to live here along time ago it must have been a small paradise" "yes"it was"
